Yakima.Parker Field:
Parker Field is a 2,500-seat baseball stadium in the northwest United States, located in Yakima, Washington. Opened 81 years ago in 1937 for the Yakima Pippins of the Western International League, it hosted various professional and amateur teams in the area prior to the opening of Yakima County Stadium in 1993.
The stadium is adjacent to Yakima Valley Community College and hosted the American Legion World Series in 1954, 1978, and 2001.
